summary.p: Ottheinrich thanks for the shipment of Bullinger's "Brevis ἀντιβολή" [against Cochläus] that arrived on January 26 [1545], for the [prefixed] dedication epistle there, and for Bullinger's accompanying letter from December 31 [1544].

div.p: Ottheinrich, by the grace of God, Count Palatine of the Rhine, Duke in Lower and Upper Bavaria, etc.

Our greetings to you. Highly learned, dear, special one, we have received your letter dated in Zurich in the Confederation, on the last day of December, along with the sent book on the twenty-sixth day of this month, and we express our gracious thanks to you for such (such) your writing and the work you have done, as well as for your humble offer. We also wish to acknowledge this with grace towards you; and since such a book is quite large, we will read it diligently with good leisure, and, if necessary, write back to you about it. We did not want to withhold this gracious opinion from you.
Dated Heidelberg, the 31st day of January in the year etc. 45.
To the highly learned, our dear, special Heinrich Bullinger, servant of the church in Zurich.
